instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: STRAP configuration for <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: I wanted to upgrade an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> to 16GB Micron RAM DDR3. Is there a strap configuration for Micron branded memory?

threads.title: STRAP configuration for <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
On the page 2 (BOM Configuration) I only see Hynix, Elpida and Samsung chips supported.
If you want to try, must play with the 4 RAMCFG lines.
